comments.body:
Sounds related to the block lag issue: https://bugs.mojang.com/plugins/servlet/mobile#issue/MCPE-48914

Everyone should go upvote that bug report. Hopefully if enough people upvote it we'll see a fix in 1.13.

To be honest. I absolutely hate the new changes in 1.14.3 pre 2. OP armour was a great feature. Iron Farms were great. Zombie Pigmen farms should be fixed and overall this is just not as fun for more hardcore players.
v About Pre-2, You should make god armors and fix your zombie pigman farms before updates, And (Java Parity) means features that needs to be added to Minecraft: Bedrock from Java
As in, you would like it to be narrow from base to head, or as in, it is narrow from base to head and you would like it not to be?
IMO the bedrock model looks better. Either way, they should probably be made to look consistent. maybe the java model is used if fancy graphics is disabled?

The bedrock piston looks much better/more detailed. It looks more like an actual piston with a hydraulic cylinder. When it's extended you can see exactly how it is constructed and how it would collapse when it closes. They did a nice job with that one. The java version is very simple. If anything Java should be given the bedrock version for parity.
Heart effect or..?
I do agree with you, and it should be added to Bedrock!

You just have to click 5 times?  I sometimes have to click well over 25 times.

This was likely an issue with Windows 10, Achievements on Windows 10 are recorded onto a companion, meaning that NO achievements can be earned without cheats disabled, while java's achievements are capable of being altered, and their possible to be deleted or given through commands, meaning that Java has more free achievements than Windows 10, this is also because Achievements are Recipes in Java edition, other than trophies, since Window's 10's achievement's are progress in one or more worlds

You see, achievements and advancements are different things.

Advancements are saved to one world, however achievements are saved to the entire account.
add advancements to bedrock and achievements to java so we can choose to enable them if we want or not. also add a sort of reward for earning an advancement to encourage people to do so
i think this is a great idea because my brother won't play minecraft without keep inventory on and were going to make a world where we try to get all the achievements/advancements
achievements are supposed to be hard, letting you get them with keepinventory on would make them way too easy
Keep inventory, in my opinion, is a playstyle, like hardcore or peaceful mode, and players should not be punished for using it.
i personally think this would be an epic feature because i cant run java becuase my pc is a potato.
i hate it when my favorite server has not updated yet, but my client updated without asking me. hope they add this soon!

They would most likely need to change the whole way they do snapshots, since there program on java and xbox for snapshots is very different than the other consoles, but I really do wish snapshots were on all devices, since you would be able to try out the new stuff instead of sobbing in the corner in your room after seeing all the freaking youtubers who use these snapshots, when the people who can't afford to get a computer to play minecraft on have to suffer the torture. The combat tests are for Java PvP, Mojang isn't making any changes from what I know of to Bedrock PvP.

The combat test aren't going out for bedrock due the delivery system of the betas, due the use of the different store like Microsoft, goggle or Apple, they cannot launch more that 1 beta at same time so if they have to take a choose between a mayor release beta and the combat test... It's a easy choose
Also the betas aren't come out instantly, they have to sent to the store like Google play store to get the aut to launch the beta update and then was publish
This process may take 1 or 2 week of delay until the beta end to public release of beta
this is all for bedrock parity

Do not add a ban system in Java Edition!

Adding global ban system in Java means server owners can do anything they want, and stepping into the wrong server means potential grounds of losing your Minecraft account.

I remember a server that banned me only on that server for the owner's personal reasons, and experiencing griefing from one of its staff members in another server on a server they were not supposed to grief, as well as a potential DDoS attempt from that said owner as I noticed my home's IP address changing twice not too shortly after the ban. In fact, the owner of said server even went as far as making IRL threats with my IP address too.

Global bans will empower server owners like these. If said thing is implemented, people are not going to be able to speak out against those server owners in any platform, not even WordPress, without the risk of losing their Minecraft Java accounts. Do not implement this into Java Edition.

By making a Java Parity Ban system, I meant to make a way to ban people from your online world in Bedrock Edition and nothing more than that. Back in November, there was no universal ban system for Bedrock Edition, and I wish for them to remove that. But all I want is a ban system for online worlds, that's all.
